trans-unit.source: Determines whether the specified bitmap has an alpha channel

seg-source.mrk: Determines whether the specified bitmap has an alpha channel

target.mrk: Determines whether the specified bitmap has an alpha channel

trans-unit.source: Handle to the bitmap to test. This bitmap must be a 32 bits-per-pixel.

seg-source.mrk: Handle to the bitmap to test.
This bitmap must be a 32 bits-per-pixel.

target.mrk: Handle to the bitmap to test.
This bitmap must be a 32 bits-per-pixel.

trans-unit.source: True - The specified bitmap has an alpha channel.

seg-source.mrk: True - The specified bitmap has an alpha channel.

target.mrk: True - The specified bitmap has an alpha channel.

trans-unit.source: This function only works with 32 bits-per-pixel uncompressed bitmaps. If the source bitmap is non 32 bits-per-pixel

seg-source.mrk: This function only works with 32 bits-per-pixel uncompressed bitmaps.
If the source bitmap is non 32 bits-per-pixel

target.mrk: This function only works with 32 bits-per-pixel uncompressed bitmaps.
If the source bitmap is non 32 bits-per-pixel

trans-unit.source: bitmap, or is a compressed bitmap, the _WinAPI_IsAlphaBitmap() always returns 0.

seg-source.mrk: bitmap, or is a compressed bitmap, the _WinAPI_IsAlphaBitmap() always returns 0.
